Description: Rim and neck fragment of Attic black-figured pottery neck-amphora. Inside glazed, with added red band at top of neck, below offset of lip; top of lip reserved, its exterior, black. On the neck, a palmette-lotus chain; added red for the hearts of the lotuses and alternate fronds of the palmettes.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 74, no. 243 pl. 54)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0860)
